page.title: 04A farrowing unit
page.content: The female pig (sow) produces her piglets 115 days after she has been serviced by the boar.In this particular unit four sows were housed with an average of 10 piglets each.Each sow was contained in a steel crate to prevent her rolling onto the tiny piglets while they are feeding from her teats.Beside each crate was a creep-an area with a heat lamp keeping it warm-where the piglets could go to sleep.Soon after they were born they had their front teeth removed to protect the sow's teats. After three weeks the sow and her piglets were moved into a barn where the piglets began to feed on a mixture of oats,barley and wheat. When the piglets weigh about 75 kilos they are taken to Banbury Market and sold to other farmers for breeding or to butchers for bacon and sausages.
